message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CL 

This paper is primarily focused on analyzing the learning properties of logistic and softmax losses in deep neural networks for visual recognition tasks in computer vision. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of class-wise reweighted versions of these losses, which is a common technique in machine learning for dealing with class imbalances. This suggests that the paper could also be relevant to the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also analyzes the necessary conditions for convergence to a local minimum, which is a topic that falls under the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper evaluates its proposed method on several benchmark datasets, which could make it relevant to the sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language).
